timeline.message:
Map registry tracker again :sweat:

Signed-off-by: liach <liach@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: This one is a little bit confusing, it sounds like you're getting a dimension type rather than a registry of them.
timeline.author: Earthcomputer

replies.bodyText: Hmm? I thought this is okay as we have like getBlocks for block tags in like the tag holder. registryManager.getDimensionType should be clear?
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Following that pattern, it would be getDimensionTypes (plural)
replies.author: Earthcomputer

replies.bodyText: Plural sounds good to me if it's a registry that's being returned here.
replies.author: shartte

timeline.bodyText:
Who do I have to mug to get a class javadoc over here?
I have a hunch what this is for, but not really a goooood idea.
timeline.author: shartte

replies.bodyText:
Maybe don't be rude about it, because a javadoc isn't a requirement to get a PR merged... a good javadoc would look something like:

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            CLASS net/minecraft/class_5455 net/minecraft/util/registry/DynamicRegistryManager
          
          
            
            CLASS net/minecraft/class_5455 net/minecraft/util/registry/DynamicRegistryManager
          
          
            
            	COMMENT Stores the registries that are not hardcoded. These registries may be changed for example via a
          
          
            
            	COMMENT datapack, and some may be synced with the client on login. For the vanilla values of these
          
          
            
            	COMMENT registries, see {@linkplain BuiltinRegistries}.
replies.author: Earthcomputer

replies.bodyText: Oh, sorry. I didn't intend to be rude, just snarky :<

timeline.author: Earthcomputer

replies.bodyText: an info is a registry handling logic. i'd say registry handling logic is more clear.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: What do you mean by "handling"? It's also bad grammar because "logic" is not a count noun.
replies.author: Earthcomputer

replies.bodyText: The Info class is a logic to handle a particular registry's serialization behavior.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText:
Yes but:

nowhere else do you refer to refer to the Info class as "registry handling logic"
"registry serializing logic" is better
if that's what the Info class is, why not rename it from Info to SerializingLogic?
your grammar is still wrong.

Each minecraft server has a dynamic registry manager for file-loaded + COMMENT registries, while each client play network handler has a dynamic registry + COMMENT manager for server-sent dynamic registries.
